Tucson did not wish to wear Vestige out.  Now that he was safely on his fee=
t, he could transform into his vehicle mode and does so readilly, gently op=
ening his driver's side door for Vestige, and lowering his left wheels down=
 to where the old Autobot could get into him easier.

" If you ask me, I th=
ink we'll get there a lot sooner of I take to the wheels instead of my feet=
.  You can drive me to where we need to go, I don't mind.  And sometimes, t=
rust just comes from the heart.  And a heart that trusts, is a heart that's=
 compassionate, and a heart that feels compassion is one that has true powe=
r.  Nothing can overpower that, nothing.  That's what I keep telling everyo=
ne back at Autobot Headquarters.  It doesn't matter if you have powerful we=
apons, if you don't have what truely matters, then you have hardly anything=
 at all.  You have more than that to go around old friend, I can feel it.  =
Now, let's get you to your repair chamber. Oh, if you feel weak, just let m=
e know and I'll take over."

He waits for Vestige to get in. 

--- In nbwrp=
g@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > <OLD>
>=
 >
> > Tucson narrows his optics. A bit un nerved, but not frightened enoug=
h to turn back and run. Instead, he would press on, and while doing so, whi=
le holding Vestige in one arm, as his strength could allow him, with the ot=
her arm, he reaches for a spare emergency canister of energon which he had =
saved for dire need. This was that dire need. He opens it, and holds it for=
 Vestige to drink from it.
> >
> > " I don't know where we can find a repai=
r chamber, but this should help you find just a little bit more energy. It'=
s my last reserve, but you need this more than I do. Here, drink, it's ener=
gon, and it will help you keep some energy in your body."
> >
> > At the sa=
me time, Tucson was keeping an ear out for the metallic spiders and insects=
. His pace steady, as he continues to walk forward, keeping his headlights =
a blaze to light his way.
> >
> > "We'll get through this Vestige, I promis=
e you."
> 
> Vestige's systems flicker and sputter as Tuscon feeds him the =
energon
> and then with a small burst of energy his optics brighten. "Thank=
 you
> Tuscon." he said, his voice horse and raspy but clearer than before.=

> It is obvious that although Vestige is doing a little better he is
> sti=
ll in need of repairs. For some reason his self repair circuits do
> not se=
em to be healing as effeciently as they should.
> 
> He nods as Tuscon prom=
ised to get them through, "I . . . I don't know
> why, but I feel as if I c=
an trust you." he says, his voice weak but
> still clear. With a shaky arm =
he points further down the path that
> Tuscon is taking them, "There is whe=
re I must go, down there. The
> chamber where I need to be sits there."
> 
=
> The direction that Vestige points is simply a long hallways, that
> after=
 maybe 30 yards or so bends around a corner and apparently
> continues on. =
There are doors on either side of the hall at different
> points, and light=
s on the cieling illuminate the hall ahead. So far
> there is no evidence o=
f insects, and whatever scraping noise that was
> heard before seems to be =
much further away.
> 
> Vestige climbes unsteadily to his feet, and much li=
ke an old man
> attempts to hobble slowly down the hall, seemingly focused =
on the task
> ahead. "Come." he says, his voice weak, but now filled with a=
 grim
> determination.
> 
> (TAG)
